org.eng.aisp.client.iotp

Class AbstractIOTPClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eng.aisp.client.iotp.IOTPlatform
      • org.eng.aisp.client.iotp.AbstractIOTPClient
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    IOTPApplicationClient

    public abstract class AbstractIOTPClient
extends IOTPlatform
    Provides useful methods that require and APIClient. The APIClient is provided by the subclasses through the api() method.
    Author:
    dawood

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractIOTPClient

        public AbstractIOTPClient(String orgID,
                          String apiKey,
                          String authToken)
        Parameters:
        usingGWConnectedSensors - if sensor devices accessed are created under a GW instead of as a free-standing device.
        orgID - the organization identifier of an IOT platform instance
        apiKey - the api key to use to authenticate with the platform.
        authToken - the token used to authenticate with the platform.

      • AbstractIOTPClient

        public AbstractIOTPClient(Properties props)
        Parameters:
        usingGWConnectedSensors - if sensor devices accessed are created under a GW instead of as a free-standing device.
        props - properties containing keys for the values provided to #IOTPApiClient(String, String, String).

    • Method Detail

      • api

        protected abstract com.ibm.iotf.client.api.APIClient api()
        Called on the subclass to get the APIClient instance after #connect() has been called.
        Returns:
        null if not connected.

                                                  throws KeyManagementException,
                                                         NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Get the APIClient instance configured by the properties in this instance.
        Returns:
        never null.
        Throws:
        KeyManagementException
        NoSuchAlgorithmException

      • getConnectionProperties

        protected Properties getConnectionProperties()
        Get the properties for connecting with API key. Properties include
        • OrganizationIDKey = value provided to constructor
        • APIKeyKey = value provided to constructor
        • AuthenticationTokenKey = value provided to constructor
        • AuthenticationMethodKey = "apikey"
        • id = "API" + random
        Returns:

      • isDeviceCreated

        public boolean isDeviceCreated(UserProfile userProfile,
                               DeployedSensor sensor)
                        throws IOException
        See if the given device is created. A side effect is that the device type for then sensor will be created.
        Parameters:
        userName -
        sensorName -
        Returns:
        Throws:

      • isDeviceCreated

        public boolean isDeviceCreated(String devID)
                        throws IOException
        See if the device with the given user-defined name is created.
        Parameters:
        devID - user-defined name/id of device.
        Returns:
        true if exists.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • addDevice

        public String addDevice(UserProfile uprofile,
                        DeployedSensor sensor,
                        String sensorID)
                 throws IOException
        Create a device that does not already exist.
        Parameters:
        uprofile -
        sensor -
        sensorID -
        Returns:
        null if device exists, otherwise the auth-token that must be saved by the caller for subsequent connections to this device. This token will generally need to be provided to IOTSensorClient's constructor.
        Throws:
        AISPException
        IOException

      • addDevice

        public String addDevice(String deviceID,
                        Properties deviceInfo,
                        Properties metaData)
                 throws IOException
        Add the device with the given user-defined ID/name.
        Parameters:
        deviceID - name/id to assign to the device. must be unique on the platform.
        deviceInf - optional properties to attach to the device in it's deviceInfo field.
        dataSet - optional properties to attach to the device in it's metadata field.
        Returns:
        null if device with given deviceID already exists, otherwise the deviceToken.
        Throws:
        IOException
